hi

It is highly recommended to play all the Half-life game series or at least you should play the Portal 1 first before you start playing this game. Because all those games related to this, Portal 2 is more like a spin-off from Half-life universe. Portal 2 is a simple game about a test subject named Chell finding her way out from the secret facility. You will be surprised how difficult challenges are given and how well the story started to weave as you play along.

The game mechanics are great, the puzzles are quite challenging, and the story is amazing. If you are the kind of person who likes conspiracy theory stuff, this is the game for you. Did I forget to mention that it does have a good story? Yeah, trust me it does have great storyline regardless if you ever played or finished any of the Half-life games or not. Because I never finished any of the Half-life games before and I still find Portal and Portal 2 as the best games Valve ever produced.

P.S; The Cake is a lie, the same goes with the Deer.

I would recommend playing Half Life series as well because there are references to which both games have about each other. Overall I think it would be a game you would play a few times. The game overall is a good game which you need to get if you enjoy puzzle solving or Valve games.

This game is literally the most incredible puzzle game you will ever play. Brilliant and orignal Sci-Fi Dystopian story with a nice dark tone set in the Half-Life universe. Challenging and well-thought-out puzzles that progressively change with more and more features. A puzzle game that still manages to make combat an epic puzzle on it's own. Graphics are good for its time (4 years ago now). Voice acting is superb and the music is incredibly well-done. Throw in multiplayer and the capability for custom chambers and you have a the single highest rated game on Steam. Seriously, buy this game. Get your friends to buy this game. Do it. I literally have no negatives for it.

500/10

If you have a computer, there is no excuse not to play this game. Portal 1 was great, but lacked the hilarity, personality, and replayability of Portal 2. With a brilliant cast of characters (morons), a unique environment to explore, and the wonderfully crafted puzzles that will leave you with either a headache or a sense of elation when you complete them. The co-op is good as well, but since I haven't yet completed it I can't really say much about it.

I will say this though. Valve's idea of community-made test chambers is brilliant. Some of the map makers have gone far beyond the built-in creation software and made their own levels entirely.

All in all, one of my favorite games of alll time.

10/10 would look into operational end of the device again.

[h1]Portal 2 is an awesome game.[/h1]

     If you disliked the prior game, Portal, because you saw that it had little content, but still enjoyed the gameplay mechanics with portals, buying this is highly recommended. Portal 2 is, what you would have already guessed by the title, is a sequel to Portal (One that takes place an incredibly long time after. So long, that no one knows HOW long). But unlike Portal, it has much more content such as the different types of gell. And if you have claustrophobia and can't stand those horrible, small test chambers, be prepared for an adventure as you run your way between the walls of chambers and find yourself in a whole different part of Aperture Laboratories, where you get to hear pre-recorded messages from Cave Johnson and play in ancient testing chambers that were once done by other test subjects. On your way through the story, you will find many things, such as humor, mysteries (with sometimes shocking conclusions), the "I'm Different" turret, and other easter eggs scattered throughout the game. You will experience a great storyline and challenging puzzles that are made for geniuses like you. If you eventually get bored of the main story, try some co-op mode that has its own array of puzzles especially made for cooperative play, or community test chambers, where you can create, play, and upload your own testing chamber creations, or play what others have made!

     Lastly, once you own Portal 2, you can download and play a completely free, fan-made mod that is an "alternate ending+sequel" to Portal 2 named [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/286080/]Thinking with Time Machine[/url]. It uses most of Portal 2's content and mechanics, but focuses more around an incredible custom gameplay mechanic that has to do with time manipulation. This allows very difficult levels to create that offer great challenge. I would highly recommend buying Portal 2 and getting this if you are interested in this mod.

     Overall, Portal 2 is a great improvement of Portal. It has full controler support and was made using great creativity, logic, and talent.
